thread.title: Candidates for Charleston City Council, District 3
thread.title_full: Candidates for Charleston City Council, District 3 - Post and Courier

author: postandcourier.com
title: Candidates for Charleston City Council, District 3
text:
Jimmy Bailey Jimmy Bailey Age: 40
Residence: Hampton Park Terrace
Occupation: Community management executive
Education: Bachelors degree in English, University of South Carolina; certificate, Graduate School of Banking at Louisiana State University
Political experience: None
Contact information: (843) 872-9842, jimmybaileyjr@gmail.com , www.jimmybaileyjr.com
How I spend my spare time: Children’s activities, boat, beach, large extended family
What makes me qualified for this office: Professionally, I’ve had responsibility for constituent service, infrastructure, large budgets, recreation, architectural review, security, and many services typically seen in a municipality.
If elected, my top priority would be: Constituent service, pushing for bolder action than we’ve had in the past on traffic and congestion, advocating for smarter growth management, and supporting public schools .
James Lewis Jr. Age: 66
Residence: West Side
Occupation: Retired Department Manager for Piggly Wiggly, Inc.
Education: Attended Cummins Theological Seminary
Political experience: Charleston City Council member since 1995
Contact information: (843) 901-3897, james.lewisjr2011@comcast.net , www.jameslewisjr.com
How I spend my spare time: Working on problems, issues and concerns for my constituents.
What makes me qualified for this office: I serve my constituents faithfully; I work with the mayor and City Council members to ensure that the city of Charleston is safe, and that we have a balanced budget.
If elected, my top priority would be: Affordable housing, crime reduction, keeping taxes down, and providing elite constituent services for a better quality of life for all citizens.
Luqman S. Rasheed Age: 63
Residence: North Central neighborhood
Occupation: Trucking industry maintenance; retired plumber and taxi driver
Education: Certification from the United Association Plumbers & Pipefitters
Political experience: None
Contact information: (843) 566-3481, imamrasheedls@yahoo.com
How I spend my spare time: Community service, playing saxophone, Sunday school instructor, family vacations.
What makes me qualified for this office: For nearly 20 years, I have served the Charleston community as an advocate for education, beautification and public safety. My leadership and service will continue to voice citizens’ concerns.
If elected, my top priority would be: Education and working to improve failing schools; housing, by allocating a specific percentage of new housing for living-wage workers; and transportation by developing a transportation hub north of Mount Pleasant Street.
